channel.title: Portforwarding your Belkin router
channel.description:
Okay I know that alot of people have trouble with portforwarding and they switch to uturrent, well not today! I am here to help yous with your Belkin router! If you would like another type of router just send a message ill see if I can add it on to here. ---Getting your default gateway--- 1.start>run>"cmd">enter>"ipconfig">find default gateway
[URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100403-88da-60kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100403-88da-60kb.jpg[/img][/URL] ---------------------------------
[b]1. go to [/b] "Your default gateway" in your internet. [b] should take you here VVVVVVVV[/b] [URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-oms7-70kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-oms7-70kb.jpg[/img][/URL]
[b]2. Click on [/b]DHCP Client List [b] under [/b]LAN setup [b] on the side.[/b]
We are now finding out which computer you are on your network.
[URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-3ix2-53kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-3ix2-53kb.jpg[/img][/URL]
[b]3. a.)Now click on "Virutal Servers" under the "Firewall" section.
b.)Change "Inbound Port" and "Private Port" to "43594" on both sides link in the picture.VVVVV
c.) In "Private IP Address" but the number from before so mine would be "8"
d.) Change the "Description" to what ever you would like it to be.
e.) Change "Type" to "TCP".
f.) Then click the "Enable" button so that it has a small green chrck mark in it.
g.) Lastly click "Apply Changes"
[URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-garu-69kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-garu-69kb.jpg[/img][/URL]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Now we are going to check our ports!
[url=http://portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm]http://portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm[/url]
[URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-suzp-21kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-suzp-21kb.jpg[/img][/URL]
DOWNLOAD THE "PFPORTCHECK PROGRAM"
Desktop icon looks like this--- [URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-vard-2kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-vard-2kb.jpg[/img][/URL]
When you open it it looks like this:
[URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-zgbd-51kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-zgbd-51kb.jpg[/img][/URL]
---the 192.168.2.8 is the private ip I entered for my router to portforward. Make sure it says what ever yours was. Port number to check enter: "43594". Protocol: "TCP" --Because thats what we entered in the router. Make sure you have everything closed that would interfere. Like, Router page "Default Gateway" or "Team Viewer" or "Hamachi" or a "RunServer" ----Now click "CHECK ME"
If everything is not closed you will get this: [URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-zstc-15kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-zstc-15kb.jpg[/img][/URL] --If everything is closed you will get this if forwarded right: [URL=http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/20100402-pxgm-58kb][IMG]http://my.jetscreenshot.com/demo/m_20100402-pxgm-58kb.jpg[/img][/URL] ------If it was not forwarded right you will get on the right it will say something like: Port was not forwarded right
~Thanks for your time~ Dragon39990 RSPS IGN: Sassafras[/b]

item.title: Portforwarding your Belkin router
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I don’t understand why people post stuff like this. They are only going to get bad feedback and flame.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your Belkin router
item.dc:creator: @yoder yoder
item.description:
@yoder wrote:

[quote=“winslow, post:7, topic:335251”][size=14pt]ON YOUR BELKON[/size]
1.Go too virtual private server’s!
2a.Type your gateway ip in the first box…fill out your ports…(43594 or what ever yours is…)
2b.Type your ip in !! not your gateway ip! ipchicken.com
3.MAKE SURE YOU CLICK ACTIVATE…(a little check box you will see it…)
4.Click the add changes button and it will restart your belkon router…

[size=14pt]Our Windows Firewall[/size]
1.Open Windows firewall advanced settings
2.Go to Inbound and then create new
3.Fill out the install (type your port)
4.Go to outbound and then create new
5.Fill out the install (type your port again)
6.Restart your computer!

Wooh all your problems are fixed![/quote]

Nice 2 year bump, bro.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your Belkin router
item.dc:creator: @winslow winslow
item.description:
@winslow wrote:

[size=14pt]ON YOUR BELKON[/size]
1.Go too virtual private server’s!
2a.Type your gateway ip in the first box…fill out your ports…(43594 or what ever yours is…)
2b.Type your ip in !! not your gateway ip! ipchicken.com
3.MAKE SURE YOU CLICK ACTIVATE…(a little check box you will see it…)
4.Click the add changes button and it will restart your belkon router…

[size=14pt]Our Windows Firewall[/size]
1.Open Windows firewall advanced settings
2.Go to Inbound and then create new
3.Fill out the install (type your port)
4.Go to outbound and then create new
5.Fill out the install (type your port again)
6.Restart your computer!

Wooh all your problems are fixed!

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your Belkin router
item.dc:creator: @dragon39990 dragon39990
item.description:
@dragon39990 wrote:

Okay I know that alot of people have trouble with portforwarding and they switch to uturrent, well not today!  I am here to help yous with your Belkin router!  If you would like another type of router just send a message ill see if I can add it on to here.

—Getting your default gateway—
1.start>run>“cmd”>enter>“ipconfig”>find default gateway

1. go to “Your default gateway” in your internet.
should take you here VVVVVVVV

2. Click on DHCP Client List under LAN setup on the side.

We are now finding out which computer you are on your network.

[b]3. a.)Now click on “Virutal Servers” under the “Firewall” section.

     b.)Change "Inbound Port" and "Private Port" to "43594" on both sides link in the picture.VVVVV

      c.) In "Private IP Address" but the number from before so mine would be "8"

        d.) Change the "Description" to what ever you would like it to be.
           
           e.) Change "Type" to "TCP".
             
              f.) Then click the "Enable" button so that it has a small green chrck mark in it.

                 g.) Lastly click "Apply Changes"

Now we are going to check our ports!

http://portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm

DOWNLOAD THE “PFPORTCHECK PROGRAM”

Desktop icon looks like this—

When you open it it looks like this:

—the 192.168.2.8 is the private ip I entered for my router to portforward. Make sure it says what ever yours was.
Port number to check enter: “43594”.
Protocol: “TCP” --Because thats what we entered in the router.
Make sure you have everything closed that would interfere. Like, Router page “Default Gateway” or “Team Viewer” or “Hamachi” or a “RunServer”
----Now click “CHECK ME”

If everything is not closed you will get this:

–If everything is closed you will get this if forwarded right:

------If it was not forwarded right you will get on the right it will say something like:
Port was not forwarded right

~Thanks for your time~
Dragon39990
RSPS IGN: Sassafras[/b]

Read full topic
